The example in Bhopal on December 3 in 1984 shows firstly the tragedy and secondly how current it is.
It informs about dangerous gas on plant and thousands of people were killed (l. 31).
She chooses the verb kill to express that this isn't nature, so these deaths are caused by human behaviour.
The comparison like Hiroshima (l. 34) shows how the planet will look or would like.
The author chooses this example because nearly everyone knows about Hiroshima, so the reader has an image of the world in future.
